Title: Latin School Sentence 1: I went to Boston Latin School in 1965. Sentence 2: You were told only one of the three would graduate. Sentence 3: You looked to the left and right. Sentence 4: The teachers had an exam school tradition. Sentence 5: All three of my group graduated, luckily.

Title: Mike had hoop dreams Sentence 1: Mike loved playing basketball. Sentence 2: He wanted to become a pro. Sentence 3: A team scout notices his skills. Sentence 4: So one day while playing at game at his local gym. Sentence 5: He tells mike he would like him to tryout for their team.

Title: Online Reservation Sentence 1: Kate needed to rent a SUV for a road trip. Sentence 2: She found an email with a coupon code. Sentence 3: She was able to save $40 on with the coupon code. Title: Anita Cleans The House Sentence 1: Anita always likes to clean the house on Sunday afternoons. Sentence 2: When she is finished cleaning, she likes to have a glass of wine. Title: Board games Sentence 1: I was playing my favorite board game with my friends. Sentence 2: I was so excited about winning that I stopped playing very well. Title: Local Business Sentence 1: Tom wanted to help local businesses. Sentence 2: He didn't like big corporations taking over. Sentence 3: He felt mom and pop shops were being pushed out. Sentence 4: Unfortunately everything was severely overpriced. Sentence 5: He tried shopping at local stores.

Title: Scare Attempt and Fail Sentence 1: John was awakened by a thud inside his bedroom. Sentence 2: John quickly rolled off the bed and looked under the bed. Title: The Break Up Sentence 1: Samantha was at the pool with her boyfriend. Sentence 2: She noticed him checking out all of the bikini-clad girls. Sentence 5: It was no use though, and she left the pool and his heart that day.

Title: Bill finds his dad Sentence 1: Bill found out at the age of 18 he was adopted. Sentence 2: Bill couldn't believe it. Sentence 3: Bill had to find out the truth about his real father. Title: Stolen Bike Sentence 1: In 1993, a young couple moved into our building. Sentence 2: The building took up a collection and paid for a new bike. Title: New Mousepad Sentence 1: I went to the store to buy a new mouse pad. Sentence 2: I bought one for 50 dollars. Sentence 3: When I took it home, it broke instantly. Title: A New Day Sentence 1: His friend April could tell he was feeling down. Sentence 2: He felt his life could not get any worse. Sentence 3: Matt was having a bad day. Sentence 4: She talked to him to cheer him up. Sentence 5: After the conversation he realized tomorrow was a new day.

Title: Violin practice Sentence 1: I had a violin lesson tomorrow, but hadn't practiced at all. Sentence 2: My violin teacher would be angry if I wasn't able to play well. Title: The world series Sentence 1: I watched the MLB World Series with my dad last night. Sentence 2: We were very upset that they lost. Sentence 3: It was a close game and the Yankees lost. Sentence 4: We had a great time rooting for the Yankees. Sentence 5: We hope that they'll win tonight.

Title: Assisted Living Sentence 1: My friend Bob is 99 years old. Sentence 2: She asked about assisted living, but he did not want to go. Sentence 3: Although he was unhurt, his daughter was concerned. Sentence 4: Recently he fell twice. Sentence 5: She is trying to talk him into going.
